REV Robotics

Mini Power Module

REV Robotics designs, builds and manufactures robotics parts and components used by students for learning about science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM). Our parts are commonly used within the FIRST Robotics Competition and the FIRST Tech...

For what it’s worth, Greg did already share this in the REV 2022 Control System thread (albeit, buried a bit)…

REV Robotics - 2022 FRC Control System General Forum
Today we launched one of control system stragglers. The mini power module. This small device is designed to help an easy way to give fused downstream custom circuits from the Power Distribution Hub. They are in stock and shipping now Mini Power Module - REV Robotics [image]

Very similar functionally to the Anderson Power Pole Distribution Board built by AndyMark. One input, multiple Mini ATC outputs. The AM board is like a centimeter smaller, but requires powerpole termination rather than allowing bare wire.

It is is for a “custom circuit” this year as there are very few restrictions. I would not try to add motors to this, as I do not think that would be legal per this years rules.
